quotes.quote: It's not how much we give but how much love we put into giving.
You can give without loving, but you cannot love without giving.
For it is in giving that we receive.
Remember that the happiest people are not those getting more, but those giving more.
We should give as we would receive, cheerfully, quickly, and without hesitation; for there is no grace in a benefit that sticks to the fingers.
No one has ever become poor by giving.
By giving people the power to share, we're making the world more transparent.
To give and then not feel that one has given is the very best of all ways of giving.
If you can't feed a hundred people, then feed just one.
Only a life lived for others is a life worthwhile.
You give but little when you give of your possessions. It is when you give of yourself that you truly give.
Giving should be entered into in just the same way as investing. Giving is investing.
The manner of giving is worth more than the gift.
You give to yourself by giving of yourself.
Think of giving not as a duty but as a privilege.
Giving frees us from the familiar territory of our own needs by opening our mind to the unexplained worlds occupied by the needs of others.
I have found that among its other benefits, giving liberates the soul of the giver.
The greatest good you can do for another is not just share your riches, but reveal to them their own.
To give and not expect return, that is what lies at the heart of love.
You give before you get.
For of those to whom much is given, much is required.
It is normal to give away a little of one's life in order not to lose it all.
When you give yourself, you receive more than you give.
It is not the gift, but the thought that counts.
We must give more in order to get more, It is the generous giving of ourselves that produce the generous harvest.
Before giving, the mind of the giver is happy; while giving, the mind of the giver is made peaceful; and having given, the mind of the giver is uplifted.
We must not only give what we have; we must also give what we are.
Make all you can, save all you can, give all you can.
If you have much, give of your wealth; if you have little, give of your heart.
To give without any reward, or any notice, has a special quality of its own.
Give what you have. To someone, it may be better than you dare to think.
Giving to others will not take away from what you have but will in fact add to your life.
In Giving, a man receives more than he gives; and the more is in proportion to the worth of the thing given.
We make a living by what we get, we make a life by what we give.
Giving is the master key to success, in all applications of human life.
The wise man does not lay up his own treasures. The more he gives to others, the more he has for his own.
The best things to do with the best things in life is to give them away
Fill yourselves first and then only will you be able to give to others.
Continually give, continually gain.
The best investment with the least risk and the greatest dividend is giving.
If I cannot give bountifully, yet will I give freely.
At its best, giving is an act of worship.
The Heart That Gives, Gathers.
Give the world the best you have and the best will come back to you.
When giving comes directly from the heart, it can never disappoint or embarrass.
Give naught, get same. Give much get same.
Giving is the key to living life of abundance blessings.
The second best thing after a gift itself is the way of giving it
Giving back involves a certain amount of giving up.
The giving of love is an education in itself.
Giving and take give we hear a great deal about the Lord loving cheerful givers.
When it comes to giving charity, some people stop at nothing.
There's nothing so rare as the ability to take good advice, except the wisdom to give it.
The man who takes and never gives, may last for years but never lives.
It takes a heart filled with love to give when there is very little to give.
It's a known fact that if you want the fireplace to give you heat, you have got to keep feeding it some wood.
You can never out-give your source.
When God gives you a vision he also gives you the ability, and in his timing you'll certainly reach your destination if you persevere.
God is love. He's the source which keeps giving to the stream continually.
Take whatever He gives and give whatever He takes with a big smile.
Give a man a fish, feed him for a day; teach him how to fish, feed him for a lifetime.
Treat all men alike, Give them all the same law. Give them all an even chance to live and grow. All men were made by the same Great Spirit Chief. They are all brothers.
God gave us the gift of life. it is up to us to give ourselves the gift of living well.
The man who will use his skill and constructive imagination to see how much he can give for a dollar, instead of how little he can give for a dollar is bound to succeed.
Giving money and power to government is like giving whiskey and car keys to teenage boys.
Telling a teenager the facts of life is like giving a fish a bath.
Forgiveness is the giving, and so the receiving, of life.
When you give, you'll receive something back too.
No matter where you are in life or what your consequences are, you can give.
Friendship, at least those that I've known, is about giving.
You may give a man an office, but you cannot give him discretion.
Give in this world. Receive in the next.
You give but little when you give of your possessions. It is when you give of yourself that you truly give.
A wise lover values not so much the gift of the lover as the love of the giver.
The only gift is the portion of thyself.
We do not quite forgive a giver. The hand that feeds us is in some danger of being bitten.
If you give what can be taken, you are not really giving.
The manner of giving is worth more than the gift.
Take what you are given, not what you want to be given.
Give what cannot be taken.
You can give without loving, but you can never love without giving.
Why should we give God thanks? Because everything we have comes from God.
Christ wants to give you hope for the future.
If you give 100 percent all the time, somehow things will work out in the end.
I need to give you something impossible, as a gift, so you can feel some of my joy.
Good works is giving to the poor and the helpless.
Never regret a day in you life. Goo days give you happiness. Bad days give you experience. Worst days give lessons, and the best days give memories.
Generosity is the virtue of giving good things to others freely and abundantly.
Generosity also involves giving to others not simply anything in abundance but rather giving those things that are beneficial to others.
Generosity always intends to enhance the true well-being of those to whom something is being given.
Generous people can give may vary: money, possessions, time, attention, aid, encouragement, emotional availability and more.
Generosity is like love in a way. People often say that we increase love we have by giving it away.
Generosity is a practice, and as with anything we practice, we get better at it over time.
Generosity is willing to take risks.
Generosity invites us to put ourselves in another's shoes, see and feel the existence of a pressing need, realize that it within our power to help.
